solution_03_central_limit_theorem/03_central_limit_theorem/17_prop_between_v2

video

We determine the mean and standard deviation of the proportion sampling distribution. \[\mu ~=~ p ~=~ 0.47\] \[\sigma ~=~ \sqrt{\frac{p(1-p)}{n}} ~=~ \sqrt{\frac{(0.47)(0.53)}{122}} ~=~ 0.0451863 \]

We determine both \(z\)-scores. We get the first \(z\)-score.

\[\begin{aligned} z_1 &= \frac{\hat{p}_1 - \mu}{\sigma} \\\\ &= \frac{0.4221-0.47}{0.0451863} \\\\ &= -1.0593661 \end{aligned}\]

We get the second \(z\)-score.

\[\begin{aligned} z_2 &= \frac{\hat{p}_2 - \mu}{\sigma} \\\\ &= \frac{0.5369-0.47}{0.0451863} \\\\ &= 1.4802102 \end{aligned}\]

Then, find the standard normal probability.

\[P(-1.0593661 < Z < 1.4802102) ~=~ 0.7858749 \]

Of course, you could have rounded the \(z\)-scores, so any of the following will also get credit. \[P(-1.06 < Z < 1.48) ~=~ 0.786 \] \[P(-1.05 < Z < 1.49) ~=~ 0.785 \] \[P(-1.06 < Z < 1.49) ~=~ 0.7837 \] \[P(-1.05 < Z < 1.48) ~=~ 0.7873 \]
